posts.name: Rocinante
posts.cooked:
We’ve programmed our bot and it drove fine on Saturday (Feb 4th), but Monday it would not drive. We have checked the following:

Drive Station Connects

Joystick Connects

No Errors in Code

No Errors in Drive Station

Wiring Appears Correct

Able to Ping the RoboRIO

Motor Controllers Register Correctly

Robot Mapping Consistent All programmed in java We have a base drive chassis with nothing else at this time. The code is available at the following link:

Code for 2023 season of FRC . Contribute to michaelallen1994/ChargedUp1994 development by creating an account on GitHub.

Looking for ideas on what to check next.

Joystick Error In Debug But Not In Drive Station

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked:
I think it has to do with this line driveTrain.setDefaultCommand( Commands.run(() → driveTrain.arcadeDrive(joystick.getX(), joystick.getY()), driveTrain)); }

While the previously-described methodologies will work fine for writing command-based robot code, the command-based libraries contain several convenience features for more-advanced users that can g...

This shows the way wpilib would do it

I would put a system print in our drive method and see if it is printing if it doesn’t then I would assume it is that line.

link_counts.title: Convenience Features — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Jack R
posts.cooked:
Perhaps consider changing this to new RunCommand(() -> driveTrain.arcadeDrive(joystick.getX(), joystick.getY()), driveTrain)) It really insn’t standard convention to use Commands.run , so I would make that your first step.   However, it probably is not causing your problem.

Definetely throw some System.out.println statements in your subsystem, robotContainer, arcadeDrive and more to ensure they are being created.  They will appear in the roborRIO log after deploy.

Jack_1221:

It really insn’t standard convention to use Commands.run ,

It actually is, btw. The static factories in Commands are more concise, and not all factories have a counterpart class. In C++ they also simplify making everything a CommandPtr, that may be non-obvious otherwise.

As for the issue at hand, maybe something else is requiring the subsystem? CommandScheduler.onCommand[Initialize/Execute/Finish/Interrupt] can be used to register callbacks to ensure the commands are running (it might be useful to decorate the commands with withName() so they appear with useful names in the callbacks). Docs: The Command Scheduler — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

Btw, @Juniormunk , look at the URL of the docs you linked… that is not the official docs site, and as such is out-of-date. Especially regarding command-based docs that were overhauled a few weeks before the season.

posts.name: Rocinante
posts.cooked: Ok, we started doing some breaks to debug and discovered that we have joystick connection errors even though on the drive station it shows a stable connection. This could very well be our problem. Thank you guys for the suggestion. Now we have to figure out this new issue within debugging. If you all have any ideas on this one we would love to hear about it. Joystick button 1 on port 0 is not available in the message. Thank you all again. Good luck.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: What does the joysticks tab in the driver station show?

posts.name: Rocinante
posts.cooked: Connected with all buttons and sticks active.

posts.name: Rocinante
posts.cooked:
Well, this went very quiet, but we found how to fix this, maybe. We went into the REV hardware client software to check settings and test-fire the motors. We found an issue with a sensor. We went through the info from REV and none of it helped. We did the following steps.

changed the motor from brushless to brushed

selected and encoder under the sensor tool

changed it back to brushless, which voided out the sensor setting

cleared the sticky error

It still showed a communications error but it did run and drive when we got done. That error will probably kill us later, we will tackle that when it happens.

I hope this helps some other team out there.

Good luck team #1994 Quioxte
